metadata.title: CVE-2020-25669 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux Kernel where the functionsunkbd_reinit having been scheduled by sunkbd_interrupt before sunkbd beingfreed. Though the dangling pointer is set to NULL in sunkbd_disconnect,there is still an alias in sunkbd_reinit causing Use After Free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-201-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-201-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-201-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-136-generic - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-136-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-136-lowlatency - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-136-generic - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-136-lowlatency - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1087-kvm - 4.4.0-1087.96
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1094-aws - 4.15.0-1094.101~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-azure - 4.15.0-1108.120~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-gcp - 4.15.0-1093.106~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-201.233').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1087.96').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.135').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1094.101~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.120~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.106~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1065.73~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1145.155').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1149.159').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
